question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable and demonstrable. Create a roll call system, web version, using CSS and JavaScript.

checklist.title: Is the roll call system's core functionality fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code implements the essential features of a roll call system: adding/removing names, marking attendance (present/absent/late), and saving attendance records. Score 0 if these core functions are missing, 5 if only basic name listing exists, and 10 if comprehensive attendance tracking with timestamps and status indicators is implemented.

checklist.title: Does the system provide data persistence capabilities?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the system can save attendance data (using localStorage, sessionStorage, IndexedDB, or simulated server calls). Check if the implementation includes data export functionality (CSV/JSON/PDF formats) and retrieval of historical records. Deduct 5 points if there's no data storage, 3 points if storage exists but without export options. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the user authentication and role management implemented?
checklist.description: Assess whether the system distinguishes between different user roles (administrator, teacher, student) with appropriate permissions. Check for login functionality, session management, and role-based access controls. Deduct 5 points if no authentication exists, 3 points if roles are defined but permissions aren't properly restricted. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the system include reporting and analytics features?
checklist.description: Check if the system generates attendance statistics (per student, per class/group, or over time), visual representations of data (charts/graphs), and summary reports. Deduct 5 points if no analytics exist, 3 points if basic statistics are shown without visualization. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as duplicate names, invalid inputs, browser refresh, network issues) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. QR code check-in option 2. Geolocation validation 3. Automated absence notifications 4. Voice command support). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple ways to delete the same record) 2. Function modules unrelated to roll call (e.g., a built-in calculator) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data/view/controller layers), code reusability, and responsiveness for different devices. Deduct 5 points if global variables are overused; deduct 5 points if the code has high duplication rate (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the system doesn't work on both desktop and mobile devices. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast interactions, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
